en.av_c1: Consider searching for the record with key value 32 in this tree. We call the findhelp method with a pointer to the BST root (the node with key value 37).
en.av_c2: Check what rt is pointing to. It is not null.
en.av_c3: Check the value at the root. We find that it is greater than what we are looking for.
en.av_c4: So we want to visit the left child.
en.av_c5: We make a recursive call with the left child as the new rt.
en.av_c7: So it must be that the root value is less than what we are looking for. So we want to visit the right child.
en.av_c9: We make a recursive call with the right child as the new rt.
en.av_c11: Check the value at the root. This is the record that we are looking for.
en.av_c12: Now we will start unwinding the recursion, passing the record with key value 32 back up to the caller.
en.av_c13: Pop the recursion, now rt is back to the node with value 24.
en.av_c14: Pop the recursion, now rt is back to the node with value 37.
en.av_c15: Pop the recursion one final time to return the record with value 32 back to the original caller of findhelp.
en.av_c16: Check the value at the root. We find that it is not greater than what we are looking for.
en.av_c17: Check the value at the root. We find that it is not equal to what we are looking for.
